confidentiality.notes: While the article says the person is charged with credit card fraud, it also indicates that he did that in association with the company's godaddy account, not by taking them from the company's computer.  No indication of the data type or damage he did in the company's computers.

summary: A Fairfield man was able to hack into his former employer's computer systems, but couldn't cover his tracks, according to police.  Remy Charmoz, 62, of 160 Glengarry Street in Fairfield, is being charged with second degree computer crime and illegal use of credit cards after a six-month investigation by Wilton Police found Charmoz illegally intruded on the computer systems of his former employer, Segmark Solutions, police said. Charmoz allegedly caused $7,000 worth of damage.  Charmoz, arrested Jan. 26, last worked at Segmark in May 2011.
